body: Hi @Crearns ,  There are some properties like flushedWhere and committedWhere at MappedFileQueue, which determine whether data has been flushed to disk.  You can take a closer look at the codes of MappedFileQueue, FlushRealTimeService, etc.
OK! I will do it, thank you for your patience

broker does not hava group subcription and not open autoCreateSubscription. pls check . If this one is not enabled and configured, it has been running normally before. Coverage decreased (-0.01%) to 50.933% when pulling **14969aa389f1c87d362504a3899c19ed37a3ee51 on duhenglucky:issue_1879** into **1558e052018ae12d273e175dd3c6ba004e9e0995 on apache:develop**.
Good suggestion. RocketMQ is embracing cloud native, as you said, there are some issues at present, so PRs are welcomed to solve these issues.

@RongNanNan Since the consume offset of broadcast mode are recorded locally and not uploaded to the broker, message‘s accumulation displayed by statsAllSubCommand is equal to the total number of messages.
I will close the Issue first, but please feel free to reopen it if you have any other issues.

since ip is marked as a tag for broker, and in cloud native, in k8s ,broker usually is set by statefulset, which we can use name+namespace as the unique tag, just like xx-xx-0-ns1, yy-yy-0-ns2. so we can configure it in our own broker statefulset, and that's the unique tag in k8s just as the "ip" in vm or node

@YJFinBJ good suggestions, but IP is used throughout RocketMQ as a unique identifier, including client differentiation (this is reflected in many issues), message storage formats(IPv4&IPv6), etc. This does cause a lot of issues in the container environment, so there is very much work that needs to be done, such as the compatibility of the non-k8s environment that also needs to be considered. 

This change seems to be relatively large, so could you provide a more detailed design first so that more users from the community can participate?
I wonder why `maxReconsumeTimes ` is null. When the consumer consumes msg failed and sends the msg back to the broker,  `maxReconsumeTimes` should be set (default is 16).

Actually, the implementation of RMQ now is more common because it is based on bytes.  The serialization and deserialization are handed to the business layer.
But yeah, schema like pulsar can make it easier to use.
BTW, rocketmq-spring offered a similar feature. You can specify a user-designed object when produce/consume msgs.

@yongliangcode 非常详细的描述，看上去调整后只在slave 上面出现了上述状况，原因可能有下面几点：
（1）四个slave 应该是同时部署在了两个ecs上面，所以相对io压力会比主大一些，顺序写也会受影响，从监控上面看，内存也几乎满了。
（2）看了下内核参数的影响，有个地方有些问题：vm.dirty_ratio应该要大于vm.dirty_background_ratio，试下把vm.dirty_ratio改为25，vm.dirty_background_ratio不变。
（3）尝试下升级操作系统，好像是有个操作系统bug也会导致相关的情况，大于2.7的内核对于内存的使用会更加激进一些，当然vm. min_free_kbytes 这些参数也不起作用了。

服务器如果那时候还进得去的话，能不能看下飙高的线程：）

Hi @ xujianhai666 , Could you provide a more detailed description of this PR？For example, detailed design and the issue to be solved. if the change is relatively large, you can submit a [RIP](https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/wiki/RocketMQ-Improvement-Proposal).
I'll close this PR first. Please feel free to reopen it if you have any other questions.

if you are using jdk 9+, use other Garbage Collector like G1
